column4: Hey guys -- could you help me figure out how to play a DVD I bought on my computer? The DVD is Terminator Salvation. It won't play.
I think it has DRM on it.
I can *see* all the files on the DVD.
for legal reasons thats not going to happen.
I'm not _stealing_ the DVD. I PAID for it... :/
so some comercial dvd's do work.. but some do not.
tell it to the courts.. it dosent matter abiouyt the dvd.. its about the encruption/protection.
how can I remove the protection?
try vlc and pointing it at the files you can see on teh disk.
or copy the files from dvd to a folder on the pc and tell vlc to play the folder

File reading failed:
2010-01-24T06:39:00.000Z	Dr_Willis	aliendude3500	 do a total boycott of dvd/movies/music - that will show them!
2010-07-09T20:50:00.000Z	Dr_Willis	aliendude3500	 you need to use the 'xhost +XXXXX' command befor you su, to allow the apps access. and perhaps Export the DISPLAY variable.
2010-07-09T20:50:00.000Z	Dr_Willis	aliendude3500	 'xhost + localhost' i think will let all local users display an app  on the current desktop.
2010-07-09T20:50:00.000Z	Dr_Willis	aliendude3500	 ive used 'sux' in the past also. :) it automates it a bit. Old-Skool style.
2010-07-09T20:51:00.000Z	aliendude3500	Dr_Willis	I tried the xhost + localhost thing, but that didn't work. I'm gonna try sux now
2010-07-09T20:51:00.000Z	Dr_Willis	aliendude3500	 you got to do it befor you su i belive
2010-07-09T20:53:00.000Z	Dr_Willis	aliendude3500	 yea. Its all part of the 'security' of X.   You dont want to let just anyone run apps on your desktopp :)
